sen.j: 松尾駅（まつおえき）は、京都市西京区松尾宮ノ前町にある、阪急電鉄阪急嵐山線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Matsuo Station (Matsuo-Eki) is a station of Hankyu Railway's Hankyu Arashiyama Line in Arashiyama Miyanomae-cho, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Matsuo Station (Matsuo-Eki) is a station of Hankyu Railway's Hankyu Arashiyama Line in Arashiyama Miyanomae-cho, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Matsuo Station, located in Arashiyama Miyanomae-cho, Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Hankyu Arashiyama Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: プラットホーム分類2面2線の、交換設備を備えた地上駅。
sen.e: The station is above the ground with exchange equipment and a platform with two sides and railway lines.
It's an aboveground station with exchange equipment and a platform with two sides and railway lines.
It is an aboveground station with two separate platforms serving two tracks, Matsuo Station has a passing loop that enables trains running in opposing directions to pass each other.
sen.cmt: 「交換施設」とは、行き先が逆の鉄道がすれ違える施設 のことではないかと解釈し、左記のようにいたしました。

sen.j: 松尾橋西詰、松尾大社前交差点東南角に位置する。
sen.e: The station is located between the Western end of Matsuo-bashi Bridge and the Southeastern corner of the crossing in front of Matsuo-taisha Shrine.
The station is located between the western end of Matsuo-bashi Bridge and the southeastern corner of the crossing in front of Matsuo-taisha Shrine.
The station is located between the western end of Matsuo-bashi Bridge and the southeastern corner of the crossing in front of Matsuo-taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 駅舎（改札口）は嵐山行ホーム嵐山寄りにあり、反対側の桂行ホームへは地下道で連絡している。
sen.e: The station hall (ticket wicket) is in the direction of Arashiyama Station on the platform for trains bound for the Arashiyama Station and is connected with a subway passage to the platform for trains bound for Katsura Station on the opposite side.

The station hall (ticket wicket) is in the direction of Arashiyama Station on the platform for trains bound for Arashiyama Station and is connected by means of a subway passage to the platform for trains bound for Katsura Station on the opposite side.

The station building (ticket gate) is in the direction of Arashiyama Station of the platform for trains bound for Arashiyama, and is connected with a underground passage to the platform for trains bound for Katsura on the opposite side.
sen.cmt: 駅舎→staiton building 地下道→underground passage と統一しました。

sen.j: ※のりば番号は設定されていない。
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。
他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 28系統：（嵐山経由）大覚寺行／（四条大宮経由）京都駅行
sen.e: Route 28: Bound for Daikakuji Temple via Arashiyama Sta./Bound for Kyoto Sta. via Shijo Omiya
Route 28: Bound for Daikakuji Temple via Arashiyama Station (bound for Kyoto Station via Shijo Omiya)
Route 28: Bound for Daikaku-ji Temple via Arashiyama Station/ bound for Kyoto Station via Shijo Omiya
sen.cmt: スラッシュを追加しました。

sen.j: 29系統：（国道中山経由）洛西バスターミナル行／（松尾橋経由）四条烏丸行
sen.e: Route 29: Bound for Nakayama Rakusai Bus Terminal via Kokudo Nakayama/Bound for Shijo Karasuma via Matsuo-bashi Bridge
Route 29: Bound for Nakayama Rakusai Bus Terminal via Kokudo Nakayama (bound for Shijo Karasuma via Matsuo-bashi Bridge)
Route 29: Bound for Rakusai Bus Terminal via Kokudo Nakayama/bound for Shijo Karasuma via Matsuo-bashi Bridge
sen.cmt: スラッシュを追加しました。
他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 平成15年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約2,701人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: According to the statistics of Kyoto Prefecture, the number of passangers per day in fiscal 2003 was about 2,701.
According to the statistics of Kyoto Prefecture, the number of passengers per day in fiscal 2003 was approximately 2,701.
The number of passengers per day in fiscal year 2003 was approximately 2,701 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月9日 新京阪鉄道嵐山線開通と同時に、松尾神社前駅として開業。
sen.e: On November 9th 1928, the Station began its operation as Matsuo-jinjya-mae Station at the same time as the Shinkeihan Railway Arashiyama Line.
On November 9,h 1928, the station went into operation as Matsuo-jinjya-mae Station concurrently with the Shinkeihan Railway Arashiyama Line.
November 9, 1928: The station went into operation as Matsuo-jinja-mae Station concurrently with the Shinkeihan Railway Arashiyama Line.
sen.cmt: 不要な文字（h）を削除しました。Matsuo-jinjya-mae→Matsuo-jinja-maeに変更しました。

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15th 1930, due to company mergers, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
On September 15, 1930, it became a station of Keihan Electric Railway due to company mergers.
September 15, 1930: It became a station of Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
sen.cmt: 会社合併→as a result of amalgamation として統一しました。

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1st 1943, due to company mergers, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway),
On October 1, 1943, it became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) due to company mergers.
October 1, 1943: It became a station of Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
sen.cmt: 会社合併→as a result of amalgamation として統一しました。

sen.j: 1944年（昭和19年）1月9日 資材供出のため全線単線化。
sen.e: On January 9th 1944, all the railway lines became single, because of the need to supply materials.
January 9, 1944: All the railway lines became single due to the need to supply materials.
January 9, 1944: All the railway lines became single due to the need to supply materials.
It became a station where two trains could pass each other.
It became a station where two trains could pass each other.
It became a station where two trains could pass each other.

sen.j: 1948年（昭和23年）1月1日 松尾駅に改称。
sen.e: On January 1st 1948, its name was changed into Masuo Station.
On January 1, 1948, its name was changed to Masuo Station.
January 1, 1948: Its name was changed to Matsuo Station.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
他ファイルと統一しました。
他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 上桂駅 - 松尾駅 - 嵐山駅 (阪急)
sen.e: Kamikatsura Station – Matsuo Station – Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
Kamikatsura Station – Matsuo Station – Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
Kamikatsura Station – Matsuo Station – Arashiyama Station (Hankyu Railway)
